alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 9:47PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Norton and central Decatur Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 947 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Oberlin, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Oberlin Airport reported a wind gust of 52 mph. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Norton and central Decatur Counties, including the following locations... Kanona. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
